title: Stanislav Kostka Neumann
text: Stanislav Kostka Neumann (born: Stanislav Jan Konstantin Václav Bohudar; June 5, 1875, in <a href="Prague">Prague</a> – June 28, 1947, in <a href="Prague">Prague</a>) was <a href="Czechs">Czech</a> writer, poet, and journalist. He has undergone many stages of creative: <a href="Symbolism%20%28arts%29">symbolist</a> ("I Am an Apostle of the New Life"), <a href="Anarchism">anarchist</a> ("A Dream About a Crowd of Desperate People, and Other Verses"), landscape lyric ("The Book of Forests, Hills, and Waters"), <a href="Civilism">civilist</a> ("New Songs"), <a href="Communism">communist</a> ("Red Songs") and others. He was one of the founders of the <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20Czechoslovakia">Communist Party of Czechoslovakia</a>. He was a mentor of <a href="Jaroslav%20Seifert">Jaroslav Seifert</a> (Seifert dedicated his first book to Neumann).
